intro: Peucedanum capillaceum, commonly known as slender cowparsnip, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables such as parsley and carrots. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Peucedanum capillaceum is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
